EmailTemplate.subject: Enhancing capacity with unlicensed spectrum
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Small cells leverage unlicensed spectrum aggregation with new standards and technologies Network densification with small cells
Integrating licensed and unlicensed spectrum with small cells Small cells offer a cost-effective, scalable solution for the integration of licensed and unlicensed spectrum where more coverage and capacity is needed. Get the whitepaper <[[https://resources.nokia.com/asset/200296]]> ► Operators worldwide are looking at the unlicensed spectrum as a way to expand capacity and augment service offerings in strategic locations. Licensed Assisted Access (LAA) and LTE-WLAN Radio Aggregation (LWA) make it easier and affordable to use unlicensed spectrum with small cells. With LTE as the baseline layer, these new radio access technologies enable efficient and reliable use of unlicensed spectrum in ultra-dense small cell deployments.
Creating ultra-dense urban networks with available spectrum Discover how to leverage licensed and unlicensed spectrum, and site density solutions, such as small cells, to create ultra-dense networks in your market.
